com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.Command

  • public final class Command
extends java.lang.Object

    Represents an executable command, including its arguments and runtime environment (environment variables, working directory). This class lets a caller execute a command, get its results, and optionally try to kill the task during execution.

    The use of "shell" in the full name of this class is a misnomer. In terms of the way its arguments are interpreted, this class is closer to execve(2) than to system(3). No Bourne shell is executed.

    The most basic use-case for this class is as follows: 

       String[] args = { "/bin/du", "-s", directory };
   CommandResult result = new Command(args).execute();
   String output = new String(result.getStdout());
    which writes the output of the du(1) command into output. More complex cases might inspect the stderr stream, kill the subprocess asynchronously, feed input to its standard input, handle the exceptions thrown if the command fails, or print the termination status (exit code or signal name).

    Invoking the Bourne shell

    Perhaps the most common command invoked programmatically is the UNIX shell, /bin/sh. Because the shell is a general-purpose programming language, care must be taken to ensure that variable parts of the shell command (e.g. strings entered by the user) do not contain shell metacharacters, as this poses a correctness and/or security risk.

    To execute a shell command directly, use the following pattern: 

       String[] args = { "/bin/sh", "-c", shellCommand };
   CommandResult result = new Command(args).execute();
    shellCommand is a complete Bourne shell program, possibly containing all kinds of unescaped metacharacters. For example, here's a shell command that enumerates the working directories of all processes named "foo": 
    ps auxx | grep foo | awk '{print $1}' |
      while read pid; do readlink /proc/$pid/cwd; done
    It is the responsibility of the caller to ensure that this string means what they intend.

    Consider the risk posed by allowing the "foo" part of the previous command to be some arbitrary (untrusted) string called processName: 

      // WARNING: unsafe!
  String shellCommand = "ps auxx | grep " + processName + " | awk '{print $1}' | "
  + "while read pid; do readlink /proc/$pid/cwd; done";
    Passing this string to Command is unsafe because if the string contains shell metacharacters, the meaning of the command can be arbitrarily changed; consider: 
    String processName = ". ; rm -fr $HOME & ";

    To defend against this possibility, it is essential to properly quote the variable portions of the shell command so that shell metacharacters are escaped. Use ShellUtils.shellEscape(java.lang.String) for this purpose: 

      // Safe.
  String shellCommand = "ps auxx | grep " + ShellUtils.shellEscape(processName)
      + " | awk '{print $1}' | while read pid; do readlink /proc/$pid/cwd; done";

    Tip: if you are only invoking a single known command, and no shell features (e.g. $PATH lookup, output redirection, pipelines, etc) are needed, call it directly without using a shell, as in the du(1) example above.

    Other features

    A caller can optionally specify bytes to be written to the process's "stdin". The returned CommandResult object gives the caller access to the exit status, as well as output from "stdout" and "stderr". To use this class with processes that generate very large amounts of input/output, consider execute(InputStream, KillableObserver, OutputStream, OutputStream) and execute(byte[], KillableObserver, OutputStream, OutputStream).

    This class ensures that stdout and stderr streams are read promptly, avoiding potential deadlock if the output is large. See When Runtime.exec() won't.

    This class is immutable and therefore thread-safe.

      • Command

        public Command(java.lang.String[] commandLineElements)
        /** Creates a new Command for the given command line elements. The command line is executed exactly as given, without a shell. Subsequent calls to execute() will use the JVM's working directory and environment.
        Parameters:
        commandLineElements - elements of raw command line to execute
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if commandLine is null or empty

      • Command

        public Command(java.lang.String[] commandLineElements,
               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> environmentVariables,
               java.io.File workingDirectory)
        Just like Command(String, Map, File, long), but without a timeout.

      • Command

        public Command(java.lang.String[] commandLineElements,
               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> environmentVariables,
               java.io.File workingDirectory,
               long timeoutMillis)
        Creates a new Command for the given command line elements. The command line is executed without a shell. The given environment variables and working directory are used in subsequent calls to execute(). This command treats the 0-th element of commandLineElement (the name of an executable to run) specially.
        • If it is an absolute path, it is used as it
        • If it is a single file name, the PATH lookup is performed
        • If it is a relative path that is not a single file name, the command will attempt to execute the the binary at that path relative to workingDirectory.
        Parameters:
        commandLineElements - elements of raw command line to execute
        environmentVariables - environment variables to replace JVM's environment variables; may be null
        workingDirectory - working directory for execution; if null, current working directory is used
        timeoutMillis - timeout in milliseconds. Only supported on Windows.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if commandLine is null or empty

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public CommandResult execute()
                      throws CommandException
        Execute this command with no input to stdin. This call will block until the process completes or an error occurs.
        Returns:
        CommandResult representing result of the execution
        Throws:
        ExecFailedException - if Runtime.exec(String[]) fails for any reason
        AbnormalTerminationException - if an IOException is encountered while reading from the process, or the process was terminated due to a signal.
        BadExitStatusException - if the process exits with a non-zero status
        CommandException

        public CommandResult execute(byte[] stdinInput)
                      throws CommandException
        Execute this command with given input to stdin. This call will block until the process completes or an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        stdinInput - bytes to be written to process's stdin
        Returns:
        CommandResult representing result of the execution
        Throws:
        ExecFailedException - if Runtime.exec(String[]) fails for any reason
        AbnormalTerminationException - if an IOException is encountered while reading from the process, or the process was terminated due to a signal.
        BadExitStatusException - if the process exits with a non-zero status
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if stdin is null
        CommandException

      • execute

        public CommandResult execute(byte[] stdinInput,
                             long timeout,
                             boolean ignoreOutput)
                      throws CommandException

        Execute this command with given input to stdin. This call will block until the process completes or an error occurs. Caller may specify whether the method should ignore stdout/stderr output. If the given number of milliseconds elapses before the command has completed, this method will attempt to kill the command.

        Parameters:
        stdinInput - bytes to be written to process's stdin, or NO_INPUT if no bytes should be written
        timeout - number of milliseconds to wait for command completion before attempting to kill the command
        ignoreOutput - if true, method will ignore stdout/stderr output and return value will not contain this data
        Returns:
        CommandResult representing result of the execution
        Throws:
        ExecFailedException - if Runtime.exec(String[]) fails for any reason
        AbnormalTerminationException - if an IOException is encountered while reading from the process, or the process was terminated due to a signal.
        BadExitStatusException - if the process exits with a non-zero status
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if stdin is null
        CommandException

      • execute

        public CommandResult execute(byte[] stdinInput,
                             KillableObserver observer,
                             boolean ignoreOutput)
                      throws CommandException

        Execute this command with given input to stdin. This call will block until the process completes or an error occurs. Caller may specify whether the method should ignore stdout/stderr output. The given KillableObserver may also terminate the process early while running.

        Parameters:
        stdinInput - bytes to be written to process's stdin, or NO_INPUT if no bytes should be written
        observer - KillableObserver that should observe the running process, or NO_OBSERVER if caller does not wish to kill the process
        ignoreOutput - if true, method will ignore stdout/stderr output and return value will not contain this data
        Returns:
        CommandResult representing result of the execution
        Throws:
        ExecFailedException - if Runtime.exec(String[]) fails for any reason
        AbnormalTerminationException - if the process is interrupted (or killed) before completion, if an IOException is encountered while reading from the process, or the process was terminated due to a signal.
        BadExitStatusException - if the process exits with a non-zero status
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if stdin is null
        CommandException

      • execute

        public CommandResult execute(byte[] stdinInput,
                             KillableObserver observer,
                             java.io.OutputStream stdOut,
                             java.io.OutputStream stdErr)
                      throws CommandException

        Execute this command with given input to stdin. This call blocks until the process completes or an error occurs. The caller provides OutputStream instances into which the process writes its stdout/stderr output; these streams are not closed when the process terminates. The given KillableObserver may also terminate the process early while running.

        Note that stdout and stderr are written concurrently. If these are aliased to each other, it is the caller's duty to ensure thread safety.

        Parameters:
        stdinInput - bytes to be written to process's stdin, or NO_INPUT if no bytes should be written
        observer - KillableObserver that should observe the running process, or NO_OBSERVER if caller does not wish to kill the process
        stdOut - the process will write its standard output into this stream. E.g., you could pass System.out as stdOut.
        stdErr - the process will write its standard error into this stream. E.g., you could pass System.err as stdErr.
        Returns:
        CommandResult representing result of the execution. Note that CommandResult.getStdout() and CommandResult.getStderr() will yield IllegalStateException in this case, as the output is written to stdOut/stdErr instead.
        Throws:
        ExecFailedException - if Runtime.exec(String[]) fails for any reason
        AbnormalTerminationException - if the process is interrupted (or killed) before completion, if an IOException is encountered while reading from the process, or the process was terminated due to a signal.
        BadExitStatusException - if the process exits with a non-zero status
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
        CommandException

      • execute

        public CommandResult execute(byte[] stdinInput,
                             KillableObserver observer,
                             java.io.OutputStream stdOut,
                             java.io.OutputStream stdErr,
                             boolean killSubprocessOnInterrupt)
                      throws CommandException
        Like execute(byte[], KillableObserver, OutputStream, OutputStream) but enables setting of the killSubprocessOnInterrupt attribute.
        Parameters:
        killSubprocessOnInterrupt - if set to true, the execution of this command is interruptible: in other words, if this thread is interrupted during a call to execute, the subprocess will be terminated and the call will return in a timely manner. If false, the subprocess will run to completion; this is the default value use by all other constructors. The thread's interrupted status is preserved in all cases, however.
        Throws:
        CommandException

      • execute

        public CommandResult execute(byte[] stdinInput,
                             KillableObserver observer,
                             java.io.File stdOut,
                             java.io.File stdErr,
                             boolean killSubprocessOnInterrupt)
                      throws CommandException
        Execute this command with given input to stdin; this stream is closed when the process terminates, and exceptions raised when closing this stream are ignored. This call blocks until the process completes or an error occurs. The caller provides OutputStream instances into which the process writes its stdout/stderr output; these streams are not closed when the process terminates. The given KillableObserver may also terminate the process early while running.

        If stdOut or stdErr is null, it will be redirected to /dev/null.

        Throws:
        CommandException

      • execute

        public CommandResult execute(java.io.InputStream stdinInput,
                             KillableObserver observer,
                             java.io.OutputStream stdOut,
                             java.io.OutputStream stdErr)
                      throws CommandException
        Execute this command with given input to stdin; this stream is closed when the process terminates, and exceptions raised when closing this stream are ignored. This call blocks until the process completes or an error occurs. The caller provides OutputStream instances into which the process writes its stdout/stderr output; these streams are not closed when the process terminates. The given KillableObserver may also terminate the process early while running.
        Parameters:
        stdinInput - The input to this process's stdin
        observer - KillableObserver that should observe the running process, or NO_OBSERVER if caller does not wish to kill the process
        stdOut - the process will write its standard output into this stream. E.g., you could pass System.out as stdOut.
        stdErr - the process will write its standard error into this stream. E.g., you could pass System.err as stdErr.
        Returns:
        CommandResult representing result of the execution. Note that CommandResult.getStdout() and CommandResult.getStderr() will yield IllegalStateException in this case, as the output is written to stdOut/stdErr instead.
        Throws:
        ExecFailedException - if Runtime.exec(String[]) fails for any reason
        AbnormalTerminationException - if the process is interrupted (or killed) before completion, if an IOException is encountered while reading from the process, or the process was terminated due to a signal.
        BadExitStatusException - if the process exits with a non-zero status
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
        CommandException

      • execute

        public CommandResult execute(java.io.InputStream stdinInput,
                             KillableObserver observer,
                             java.io.OutputStream stdOut,
                             java.io.OutputStream stdErr,
                             boolean closeOut)
                      throws CommandException

        Execute this command with given input to stdin; this stream is closed when the process terminates, and exceptions raised when closing this stream are ignored. This call blocks until the process completes or an error occurs. The caller provides OutputStream instances into which the process writes its stdout/stderr output; these streams are closed when the process terminates if closeOut is set. The given KillableObserver may also terminate the process early while running.

        Parameters:
        stdinInput - The input to this process's stdin
        observer - KillableObserver that should observe the running process, or NO_OBSERVER if caller does not wish to kill the process
        stdOut - the process will write its standard output into this stream. E.g., you could pass System.out as stdOut.
        stdErr - the process will write its standard error into this stream. E.g., you could pass System.err as stdErr.
        closeOut - whether to close the output streams when the subprocess terminates.
        Returns:
        CommandResult representing result of the execution. Note that CommandResult.getStdout() and CommandResult.getStderr() will yield IllegalStateException in this case, as the output is written to stdOut/stdErr instead.
        Throws:
        ExecFailedException - if Runtime.exec(String[]) fails for any reason
        AbnormalTerminationException - if the process is interrupted (or killed) before completion, if an IOException is encountered while reading from the process, or the process was terminated due to a signal.
        BadExitStatusException - if the process exits with a non-zero status
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
        CommandException

      • executeAsynchronously

        public FutureCommandResult executeAsynchronously(byte[] stdinInput)
                                          throws CommandException
        Executes this command with the given stdinInput, but does not wait for it to complete. The caller may choose to observe the status of the launched process by calling methods on the returned object.
        Parameters:
        stdinInput - bytes to be written to process's stdin, or NO_INPUT if no bytes should be written
        Returns:
        An object that can be used to check if the process terminated and obtain the process results.
        Throws:
        ExecFailedException - if Runtime.exec(String[]) fails for any reason
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if stdin is null
        CommandException

      • executeAsynchronously

        public FutureCommandResult executeAsynchronously(byte[] stdinInput,
                                                 KillableObserver observer)
                                          throws CommandException

        Executes this command with the given input to stdin, but does not wait for it to complete. The caller may choose to observe the status of the launched process by calling methods on the returned object. This method performs the minimum cleanup after the process terminates: It closes the input stream, and it ignores exceptions that result from closing it. The given KillableObserver may also terminate the process early while running.

        Note that in this case the KillableObserver will be assigned to start observing the process via KillableObserver.startObserving(Killable) but will only be unassigned via KillableObserver.stopObserving(Killable), if FutureCommandResult.get() is called. If the KillableObserver implementation used with this method will not work correctly without calls to KillableObserver.stopObserving(Killable) then a new instance should be used for each call to this method.

        Parameters:
        stdinInput - bytes to be written to process's stdin, or NO_INPUT if no bytes should be written
        observer - KillableObserver that should observe the running process, or NO_OBSERVER if caller does not wish to kill the process
        Returns:
        An object that can be used to check if the process terminated and obtain the process results.
        Throws:
        ExecFailedException - if Runtime.exec(String[]) fails for any reason
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if stdin is null
        CommandException

      • executeAsynchronously

        public FutureCommandResult executeAsynchronously(java.io.InputStream stdinInput,
                                                 KillableObserver observer,
                                                 java.io.OutputStream stdOut,
                                                 java.io.OutputStream stdErr,
                                                 boolean killSubprocessOnInterrupt,
                                                 boolean closeOutput)
                                          throws CommandException

        Executes this command with the given input to stdin, but does not wait for it to complete. The caller may choose to observe the status of the launched process by calling methods on the returned object. This method performs the minimum cleanup after the process terminates: It closes the input stream, and it ignores exceptions that result from closing it. The caller provides OutputStream instances into which the process writes its stdout/stderr output; these streams are not closed when the process terminates. The given KillableObserver may also terminate the process early while running.

        Note that stdout and stderr are written concurrently. If these are aliased to each other, or if the caller continues to write to these streams, it is the caller's duty to ensure thread safety.

        Note that in this case the KillableObserver will be assigned to start observing the process via KillableObserver.startObserving(Killable) but will only be unassigned via KillableObserver.stopObserving(Killable), if FutureCommandResult.get() is called. If the KillableObserver implementation used with this method will not work correctly without calls to KillableObserver.stopObserving(Killable) then a new instance should be used for each call to this method.

        Parameters:
        stdinInput - The input to this process's stdin
        observer - KillableObserver that should observe the running process, or NO_OBSERVER if caller does not wish to kill the process
        stdOut - the process will write its standard output into this stream. E.g., you could pass System.out as stdOut.
        stdErr - the process will write its standard error into this stream. E.g., you could pass System.err as stdErr.
        killSubprocessOnInterrupt - whether or not to kill the created process on interrupt
        closeOutput - whether to close stdout / stderr when the process closes its output streams.
        Returns:
        An object that can be used to check if the process terminated and obtain the process results.
        Throws:
        ExecFailedException - if Runtime.exec(String[]) fails for any reason
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if stdin is null
        CommandException

      • executeAsynchronously

        public FutureCommandResult executeAsynchronously(java.io.InputStream stdinInput,
                                                 KillableObserver observer,
                                                 java.io.OutputStream stdOut,
                                                 java.io.OutputStream stdErr)
                                          throws CommandException
        Throws:
        CommandException

      • toDebugString

        public java.lang.String toDebugString()
        A string representation of this command object which includes the arguments, the environment, and the working directory. Avoid relying on the specifics of this format. Note that the size of the result string will reflect the size of the command.
